item.text: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
Reaiah the son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. Their sister was Hazzelelponi.
Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and the father of Bethlehem.
Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

<st data-num="05292" class="">Naarah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> him <st data-num="0275" class="">Ahuzzam</st>, <st data-num="02660" class="">Hepher</st>, <st data-num="08488" class="">Temeni</st>, and <st data-num="0326" class="">Haahashtari</st>. <st data-num="0428" class="">These</st> were the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="05292" class="">Naarah</st>.

The <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="02458" class="">Helah</st>: <st data-num="06889" class="">Zereth</st>, <st data-num="03328" class="">Zohar</st>, <st data-num="0869" class="">Ethnan</st>,
and Koz, who was the father of Anub, Hazzobebah, and the clans of Aharhel the son of Harum.
Jabez was more respected than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, for she said, “I experienced pain when I gave birth to him.”
Jabez called out to the God of Israel, “If only you would greatly bless me and expand my territory. May your hand be with me! Keep me from harm so I might not endure pain.” God answered his prayer.
Kelub, the brother of Shuhah, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah, the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Recah.

The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah.

The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.

Meonothai was the father of Ophrah.

Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of those who live in the Valley of the Craftsmen, for they were craftsmen.

The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam.

The son of Elah: Kenaz.
The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon.

Mered’s wife Bithiah gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.
(His Judahite wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the sons of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered married.
The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon.

The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben Zoheth.
The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,

<st data-num="03137" class="">Jokim</st>, the <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="03578" class="">Cozeba</st>, and <st data-num="03101" class="">Joash</st> and <st data-num="08315" class="">Saraph</st>, both of <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="01166" class="">ruled</st> in <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and <st data-num="03433" class="">Jashubi Lehem</st>. (This <st data-num="01697" class="">information</st> is from <st data-num="06267" class="">ancient</st> records.)<n id="1" />
They were the potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah; they lived there and worked for the king.
The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul,
his son Shallum, his son Mibsam, and his son Mishma.
The descendants of Mishma: his son Hammuel, his son Zaccur, and his son Shimei.
Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters. But his brothers did not have many sons, so their whole clan was not as numerous as the sons of Judah.
They <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> in <st data-num="0884" class="">Beer Sheba</st>, <st data-num="04137" class="">Moladah</st>, <st data-num="02705" class="">Hazar Shual</st>,
<st data-num="01090" class="">Bilhah</st>, <st data-num="06107" class="">Ezem</st>, <st data-num="08434" class="">Tolad</st>,
<st data-num="01328" class="">Bethuel</st>, <st data-num="02767" class="">Hormah</st>, <st data-num="06860" class="">Ziklag</st>,

<st data-num="01024" class="">Beth Marcaboth</st>, <st data-num="02702" class="">Hazar Susim</st>, <st data-num="01011" class="">Beth Biri</st>, and <st data-num="08189" class="">Shaaraim</st>. <st data-num="0428" class="">These</st> were their <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="04427" class="">reign</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.

Their <st data-num="02691" class="">settlements</st> also included <st data-num="05862" class="">Etam</st>, <st data-num="05871" class="">Ain</st>, <st data-num="07417" class="">Rimmon</st>, <st data-num="08507" class="">Tochen</st>, and <st data-num="06228" class="">Ashan</st>—<st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st>,
along with all their settlements that surrounded these towns as far as Baal. These were the places where they lived; they kept genealogical records.
Their clan leaders were: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,

<st data-num="03100" class="">Joel</st>, <st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03143" class="">Joshibiah</st> (<st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08304" class="">Seraiah</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06221" class="">Asiel</st>),

<st data-num="0454" class="">Eleoenai</st>, <st data-num="03291" class="">Jaakobah</st>, <st data-num="03439" class="">Jeshohaiah</st>, <st data-num="06222" class="">Asaiah</st>, <st data-num="05717" class="">Adiel</st>, <st data-num="03450" class="">Jesimiel</st>, <st data-num="01141" class="">Benaiah</st>,

<st data-num="02124" class="">Ziza</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08230" class="">Shipi</st> (<st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0438" class="">Allon</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03042" class="">Jedaiah</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08113" class="">Shimri</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>).

These who are named above were the leaders of their clans.

Their extended families increased greatly in numbers.

They <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to the <st data-num="03996" class="">entrance</st> of <st data-num="01446" class="">Gedor</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st> of the <st data-num="01516" class="">valley</st>, <st data-num="01245">looking for</st> <st data-num="04829" class="">pasture</st> for their <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>.

They <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st> <st data-num="08082" class="">fertile</st> and <st data-num="02896" class="">rich</st> <st data-num="04829" class="">pasture</st>; the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> was <st data-num="07342 03027">very broad</st>, <st data-num="08252" class="">undisturbed</st>, and <st data-num="07961" class="">peaceful</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">Indeed</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> <st data-num="02526" class="">Hamites</st> had been <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before that</st>.

The <st data-num="0428" class="">men</st> whose <st data-num="08034" class="">names</st> are <st data-num="03789" class="">listed</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> during the <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03169">Hezekiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="05221" class="">attacked</st> the Hamites’ <st data-num="0168" class="">settlements</st>,<n id="1" /> as well as the <st data-num="04586 0834">Meunites</st> they <st data-num="04672" class="">discovered</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>, and they <st data-num="02763" class="">wiped</st> them <st data-num="02763" class="">out</st>, as can be seen <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>. They <st data-num="03427 08478">dispossessed</st> them,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they found <st data-num="04829" class="">pasture</st> for their <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.

<st data-num="02568" class="">Five</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">hundred</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="01992 04480">of</st> <st data-num="01121 08095">Simeon</st>, <st data-num="07218" class="">led</st> by <st data-num="06410" class="">Pelatiah</st>, <st data-num="05294" class="">Neariah</st>, <st data-num="07509" class="">Rephaiah</st>, and <st data-num="05816" class="">Uzziel</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03469" class="">Ishi</st>, <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to the <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st> of <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st>
and defeated the rest of the Amalekite refugees; they live there to this very day.
